subject: Course Registration Deadline Guidance
utterances: When is the deadline to register for classes?
How late can I add a course?
response_template:
Hello {student_name},

Thanks for reaching out! The registration period for {term} closes on {registration_deadline}. You can continue to add classes until 11:59 p.m. on that date through the student portal. If you need to make changes afterward, please submit an Add/Drop form and obtain approval from your academic advisor.

Here are a few tips to stay on track:
• Double-check your degree audit to ensure the courses fit your academic plan.
• Resolve any holds before the deadline so you do not lose access.
• If you run into registration errors, send us a screenshot and we will be glad to help.

Let us know if you have additional questions!

Best regards,
Academic Advising Team
follow_up_questions: Are you planning to take the course for credit or audit?
Do you have any registration holds on your account?

subject: Official Transcript Request Instructions
utterances: How do I order my transcript?
response_template:
Hello {student_name},

You can request an official transcript any time through the Registrar's transcript portal. Log in with your student credentials, select "Request Official Transcript," and follow the prompts to choose an electronic or paper delivery. Processing typically takes 1-2 business days. There is a $10 processing fee for each official copy.

If you need an unofficial transcript, you can download one instantly from the student portal under "Academic Records."

Please let us know if you require expedited mailing or if a third-party form must accompany the transcript and we will be happy to help.

Warm regards,
Academic Advising Team
follow_up_questions: Do you need the transcript sent electronically or via mail?
Is there a specific deadline you need to meet?

subject: Academic Advising Appointment Options
utterances: find a time to talk to advisor
response_template:
Hello {student_name},

We would be glad to meet with you! Advising appointments can be scheduled online through the Navigate Student app or by visiting the advising portal on the university website. You will see available 30-minute meeting times for your assigned advisor over the next two weeks.

If you do not see a time that works for you, reply with a few windows of availability and we will follow up with alternatives. Virtual meetings via Zoom are also available upon request.

Talk soon,
Academic Advising Team
follow_up_questions: Is there a specific topic you would like to discuss during the appointment?
Do you prefer an in-person or virtual meeting?

subject: Course Withdrawal Process
utterances: How do I drop a class after the deadline?
I might need to withdraw from a course
need help with course withdrawal paperwork
withdraw from a course due to personal reasons
response_template:
Hello {student_name},

To withdraw from a course after the add/drop period, please submit the Course Withdrawal form located in the Records and Registration section of the student portal. The form requires signatures from both you and the course instructor. Once approved, the Registrar will record a grade of 'W'.

Key reminders:
• The withdrawal deadline for {term} is {withdrawal_deadline}.
• Withdrawing may impact your financial aid or progress toward graduation.
• International students should consult with the Office of Global Engagement before submitting the form.

Please let us know if you would like to talk through the decision or explore alternative options.

Sincerely,
Academic Advising Team
follow_up_questions: Have you spoken with your course instructor about the withdrawal?
Would you like to review how this might impact your financial aid?

subject: Checking Your Financial Aid Status
response_template:
Hello {student_name},

You can monitor the status of your financial aid package by logging into the Financial Aid tile in the student portal. From there, review the 'To-Do List' to confirm that all documents have been submitted. Aid typically disburses to your student account starting one week before classes begin, provided all requirements are complete.

If something still looks missing, the Financial Aid Office can be reached at {financial_aid_phone} or {financial_aid_email}. Please have your student ID number handy when you call.

Let us know if we can review anything together!

Best,
Academic Advising Team
follow_up_questions: Have you completed all outstanding financial aid tasks in the portal?
Are you expecting new scholarships or loans this term?
